# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(s)
    words = split(s, " ")
    newlines = []
    currentline = ""
    for word in words
        if length(currentline) + length(word) > 10
            push!(newlines, currentline * "\n")
            currentline = word
        else
            currentline += " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(newlines, currentline * "\n")
    return join(newlines, "")
end

Example:
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed euismod tincidunt nisl, vitae pulvinar ligula. Nullam a lorem in mauris accumsan venenatis. Nunc nec lacinia magna."))
